TEXT: The applicant company is a private bank in the form of a limited liability company that was set up in DATE and has its head office at GPE ( GPE ) . It is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as presented by the applicant company , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant company has CARDINAL main activities , which are closely connected . Firstly , it offers a service for tracing missing heirs ( ORG ) with a view to being subsequently instructed to wind up the deceased ’s estate . It traces heirs , whether or not their identity is known , both in GPE and overseas , either on behalf of authorities or institutions such as the testamentary executors or the administrators , or of its own initiative . It does so at its own risk and bears the costs . It receives no down payment and , if it fails to locate the heirs , no remuneration . Secondly , once it has traced the heirs , it offers its services in winding up the estate ( GPE ) , for which it is paid a fee of PERCENT of the value of the estate .

Under the first sentence of the first paragraph of LAW ( Rechtsberatungsgesetz – see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) , the applicant company was in DATE granted the licence it required to carry on its activity . It remained licensed until DATE .

In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG ( ORG ) held that missing - heir tracing services were commercial ( gewerblich ) in character and that there was a close connection between that activity and the winding up of estates . Accordingly , the applicant company was required to pay a ORG tax ( ORG ) .

Following that judgment , in which ORG ruled only on fiscal issues , the applicant company decided in DATE to surrender its licence under section CARDINAL ) of LAW and to carry on its business unlicensed , on the basis of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) . At the time both the President of ORG and ORG ( Bundesrechtsanwaltskammer ) considered that the applicant company did not require a licence to carry on its activity .
Subsequently CARDINAL separate sets of proceedings were brought against the applicant company .

I. The first action was brought in DATE by ORG relying on LAW and LAW ( PERSON gegen den unlauteren PERSON ) . ORG submitted in particular that following a DATE amendment the applicant company ’s activity no longer fell within the terms of LAW , and accordingly the company could not receive a licence for it .
The applicant company contended that owing to the close connection between tracing heirs and winding up estates it was not required to have a licence under LAW .

In a judgment of DATE ORG ( Landgericht ) accepted the applicant company ’s argument finding that its activity of giving legal advice in the winding up of estates was a direct offshoot of its main commercial activity as genealogists .

On an appeal by ORG , ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) overruled ORG judgment on DATE and made an order restraining the applicant company from acting or offering to act for heirs ( PERSON ) , since it did not have the requisite licence under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW . ORG considered that the genealogical activity was merely a way of finding clients in order to obtain work winding up estates , that being the main profit - making activity of the applicant company and CARDINAL for which a licence was required . Furthermore , the genealogical activity was not necessarily connected to that of winding up estates as the CARDINAL could be carried on separately . In any event , the latter was not under any circumstances a subsidiary legal activity capable of coming within the exceptions set out in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of LAW . Lastly , that construction of the provision did not infringe the relevant provisions of LAW .
ORG granted the applicant company DATE to make the change on condition that it immediately sought the requisite licence under LAW .

The applicant company made a request for a licence to the competent authorities , but it was turned down . The President of ORG stated in particular that the request , which was for a licence to act on behalf of heirs , fell outside the categories of activities set out in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW . That statute had been amended in DATE and the range of services which legal advisers were entitled to offer substantially curtailed , the right to perform most legal services being reserved to lawyers . Consequently , licences could be granted only for such activities as were exhaustively set out in section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW . The activity referred to by the applicant company was not CARDINAL of them .

At the same time the applicant company lodged an appeal on points of law with ORG ( ORG ) , which was dismissed in a judgment of DATE . Like ORG , ORG considered that the applicant company could not act in the winding up of estates without the requisite licence .
The applicant company then lodged a constitutional appeal with ORG ( Bundesverfassungsgericht ) . Sitting as a committee of CARDINAL judges , ORG decided on CARDINAL DATE to dismiss that appeal .
II . The second action against the applicant company was brought in DATE by ORG on the same grounds as those relied on in the first action .
In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG found in favour of ORG .
ORG dismissed the applicant company ’s appeal on DATE .
Its appeal on points of law to ORG was also dismissed , in a judgment of DATE .
The applicant company then lodged a constitutional appeal with ORG , which , sitting as a committee of CARDINAL judges , decided on CARDINAL DATE to dismiss the appeal .

LAW ( Rechtsberatungsgesetz ) , which came into force in DATE , provides that the profession of legal adviser ( PERSON ) may , subject to certain conditions , be exercised by people not possessing legal qualifications .

The first sentence of the first paragraph of LAW ) states that “ regardless of whether it constitutes a main or subsidiary activity or is performed for a fee or free of charge , legal work ( GPE fremder GPE ) , including the giving of legal advice , may be performed for third parties only by persons licensed to do so by the relevant authorities ” .

Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL)(CARDINAL ) of the LAW provides : “ the fact that commercial or industrial undertakings perform legal work for their customers that is closely connected to their main activity ( die FAC ihres GPE in unmittelbarem GPE stehen ) shall not constitute an infringement of this Act ” .
